data.title: Implement deployment splash and icon functionality
data.body:
Per http://atomicgameengine.com/forum/#/discussion/216/how-to-change-default-game-icon-and-splash-screen

The icon and splash screen are not changeable AFAIK, but they should be. The icons seem to be ignored entirely for iOS, and possibly other platforms. Also, the "App Name" field is not used in the naming of the application (at least for iOS).

Using Mac binary release (as of 2016-04-12) and Windows (git version, same date) as reference.

data.title: Shift clone
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson 

I hope this is okay now! Sorry about that.

-Raheel

data.title: Editor: text of editor is not visible after system sleep
data.body:
After a system sleep (laptop lid close, for example) the text area doesn't refresh:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/413028/14459229/aca514b4-0084-11e6-8c2d-600d96fd5d66.png)

When you press any cursor key, a part of it redraws:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/413028/14459280/fd969bb8-0084-11e6-9acd-8da66b367063.png)

If I move the cursor far enough up, I can get the upper portion to redraw.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/413028/14459300/1a28f578-0085-11e6-8be8-59290ff8cf57.png)

Moving it down, similarly causes the lower area to redraw:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/413028/14459317/3ca8222c-0085-11e6-8609-03b619e90a35.png)

However, closing the file, and reopening it seems to be the only way to get the full area to redraw:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/413028/14459364/782e295e-0085-11e6-919f-0a8db491f1b9.png)

Irrelevant info:
If you were curious about why the file shown is different than the normal ParticleEmitter3D UI.js, I changed it to make the buttons all be the same size.

data.title: Be able to configure ACE code windows with preferences file
data.body: There should be a way to configure the Ace editors via a user preferences.  This can initially be hand-modified in the file, but ideally it should be exposed through the editor ui.  This should be elements such as font size, theme, keybindings, etc.  Basically most of the settings that can be modified via the built in ACE configuration panel accessed via "CTRL/CMD + Comma"

data.title: Per project extensions, authors update
data.body:
This PR provides the ability to have .plugin.js files in the <Project>/Resources/EditorData directory that are loaded when the project is opened. These plugins can currently add plugin menu items, respond to widget events and open modal windows.

Thanks to @shaddockh for better encapsulating the plugin loading in a new service.

Also, a long overdue addition of @JohnnyWahib and @Vlamboljant to the authors file.

data.title: Shift drag clone bug fix
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson 

The artists at Luma found a bug with the Shift+Drag cloning feature (it was cloning when you clicked anywhere in the editor) so this is a fix for that issue. 

-Raheel

data.title: Typescript error annotations
data.body:
Fixes #744 

This PR hooks in the typescript compiler warnings/errors and allows them to be displayed in the editor.  They will only show up or drop off on save (having it annotate in real-time may be a future PR).

This PR also fixes an issue where saving a file didn't update the background language service with the updated code.  It also fixes an issue where if you have a JSDoc block on a variable or method in your project, it is supposed to display the JSDoc in a tooltip on code completion.

data.title: Flip infacing normals
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson :)

This PR adds the ability to add import settings when importing models. It was needed because of the problem when adding planar models to the scene. 

How it Works:
1. Create an Import.json file in the Settings Folder of your project.
2. The Import.json allows you to set each of the postprocess flags to true or false. This is what it looks like:

```
{
  "desktop": {

    "aiFlagsDefault" : {
      "convertToLeftHanded" : true,
      "joinIdenticalVertices" : true,
      "triangulate" : true, 
      "genSmoothNormals" : true,
      "limitBoneWeights" : true,
      "improveCacheLocality" : true,
      "fixInfacingNormals" : false,
      "findInvalidData" : true,
      "genUVCoords" : true,
      "findInstances" : true,
      "optimizeMeshes" : true
    }
  }

}
```

NB: If there isn't an Import.json in the Settings folder of the game, the engine will set the flags to its default behaviour (where everything is true).

Is this okay? Please let me know if there is anything you'd like to be different. 

-Raheel

data.title: Issue #691 Profiler should exclude data from profiler output
data.body:
Divided the triangles into categories "All pass", "Single pass" and "Editor" (D3D9Graphics.cpp & h, DebugHud.cpp & h, Renderer.cpp & h, View.cpp)

Created a profiler widget to be added to the scene that lets you view the information easier when a scene is open (DebugHud.cpp & h, ResourceEditor.cpp & h, SceneEditor3D.cpp & h, SceneView.cpp, skin.tb.txt, UI.cpp)

data.title: Editor - TypeScript - Compile TS Files
data.body: On Save, need to emit a transpiled JavaScript file for the provided TypeScript file if there are no errors encountered.

data.title: Editor - TypeScript - implement error / warning annotations
data.body: Need to capture warnings and errors that are detected by the typescript language service and display markers in the editor.

data.title: Editor - Implement a central logging component
data.body:
Need to have a more robust logging component that can be used by inside the editor.  It should be able to be switched from minimal logging to full debug logging through a configuration.

*\* EDIT **
Ideally this could be set up by using the event system and publishing / subscribing to messages.  This would allow any component to send a log message out without having a hard dependency to the logging component.  There could be a listener for each type of log message that could be toggled on or off appropriately.

data.title: Ease of use fixes for some TS Bindings
data.body:
While building some examples, I made some hand modifications to atomic.d.ts.  This incorporates them into the official script bindings as well as fixes some linting issues with the generated bindings.

Currently, getting a strongly typed component from a node requires you to cast the result:

``` typescript
let node = <Atomic.Sprite2D>this.node.getComponent("Sprite2D");
```

This change adds the following signature overload in addition to the current signature:

``` typescript
let node = this.node.getComponent<Atomic.Sprite2D>("Sprite2D");
```

What this does is auto-casts the result to the component and ensures that the generic type being cast in is actually a descendent of Atomic.Component.  The same goes for `Node.getJSComponent`, `Node.createComponent`, `Node.getOrCreateComponent`, and `Component.getComponent`

Without this check, the TypeScript compiler would not catch such mis-uses as:

``` typescript
let node = <string> this.node.getComponent("Sprite2D");
```

data.title: IPC Updates for Windows child processes, WeakPtr fixes for WebClient
Dragging files into hierarchy
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson :)

A small fix to prevent the engine from crashing when you drag files into the Hierarchy Frame. I couldn't find a logged issue to reference for this though!

-Raheel

data.title: Fix for missing keystrokes in the code editor on OSX.
data.body:
Turns out this is a bug when using CEF with SDL: https://bugzilla.libsdl.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3107.
I have tested this fix and it works great for me - no more missing keystrokes in the code editor.

data.title: Issue #736 - Migrate typescript build to CI scripts
data.body: should fix #736 causing the CI server to lint the typescript and build the editor correctly.  I have no way to really test this, but I copied over the logic from the normal build process.

data.title: updated license banners
Update CI editor scripts for new TS editor extensions
data.body: The CI build scripts need to be updated to add the new TS editor extensions, see: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Build/Scripts/BuildCommon.js#L87

data.title: Shift drag cloning
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson 

This PR allows the users to clone objects in the Scene by holding down on Shift and Dragging the object. 

Let me know if you'd like anything changed! :)

data.title: Issue #195 - Search Bar Functionality
data.body:
Hi @JoshEngebretson : )

I've implemented the search bar functionality. I didn't end up using the TurboBadger filtering because I don't think it was compatible with the ProjectFrame's list type. 

Please let me know if there's anything you need to be adjusted!

-Raheel

data.title: [Win32]Player Behaves different on Debug and Release
data.body:
From the post:
http://atomicgameengine.com/forum/#/discussion/212/my-method-to-build-win32-version-and-new-issue-with-win32-player

The Editor/Player exe can be successfully built, in Debug build things works well, however, if change the build mode to Release, when running Physics Platformer, the coin didn't disappear, they works like a crate or something, bounces when touch player without disappearing.

This issue should be able to produce by build from a existing project, if not, I can upload my executable.

data.title: Handle Popup Requests by sending event on UI thread
data.body: ... avoids top level windows being spawned

data.title: Fix output path for 32 bit compile
Document 32 bit Windows editor build steps
data.body: There are a number of 32 bit Windows users who would like to run the Atomic Editor.  The build already supports this, has to be documented and possibly some build scripts updated

data.title: Better Android deployment error messages, ensure res/values folder exists
data.body: Closes #719

data.title: Updated 2D/3D templates with default camera and 2D static sprite component
data.body: closes #722

data.title: Editor Crashes and produces error log when using CMD + Q to exit.
data.body: This happens everytime I exit using CMD+Q shortcut.

data.title: Event constants should be generated in ts by JSBind
data.body: Event string constants are scattered all over the place in ts, sometimes used directly in subscribeToEvent calls. Events generated by native code should be output to Atomic.d.ts for better reference and consistency.

data.title: iOS Build Success - Fails on Deployment

I have the build details filled out and have linked a provisioning profile which is a wildcard com.research.smartfocus.*
